direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods deal with text content within the element, but 'hasText' checks for the presence of non-blank text while 'text' retrieves the normalized text.
Both methods are concerned with text content, but 'ownText' retrieves the text directly owned by the element, while 'hasText' checks for the presence of non-blank text.
Both methods deal with content within the element, but 'data' retrieves the combined data (e.g., inside <script> tags), while 'hasText' checks for the presence of non-blank text.
Both methods are related to text content and its presence, but 'isBlank' checks if the text is entirely whitespace, while 'hasText' checks for the presence of non-blank text.
Both methods are related to text content, but 'getWholeText' retrieves the non-normalized text, while 'hasText' checks for the presence of non-blank text.
